Key Arguments: The legislation infringes on freedom of speech, a fundamental human right.
The current culture is overly sensitive and does not contribute to a more discerning world.
Australians are well-educated and capable of discerning information without government intervention.
The legislation could lead to a biased narrative controlled by the government, reminiscent of totalitarian regimes.
Governments themselves have been sources of misinformation, especially in recent years.
The legislation is unconstitutional and poses a risk to citizens' rights and freedoms.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is a fundamental human right.
No government has the right to impose a 'ministry of truth'.
The current government is driving an agenda to suppress the rights and freedoms of all Australian citizens.
